<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS): 0.8 This was reported in Modin. See discussion here: <denchmark-link:https://discuss.modin.org/t/problem-when-running-code-with-modin-1-time/90/2>https://discuss.modin.org/t/problem-when-running-code-with-modin-1-time/90/2</denchmark-link>
This is related to, but not the same as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/issues/3059>#3059</denchmark-link> . See logs below <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Please provide a script that can be run to reproduce the issue. The script should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments): import ray ray.init() Logs below: <denchmark-code>2020-01-23 14:09:01,315 INFO resource_spec.py:216 â€“ Starting Ray with 30.32 GiB memory available for workers and up to 15.16 GiB for objects. You can adjust these settings with ray.init(memory=, object_store_memory=). F0123 14:09:07.020850 1052 redis_context.cc:215] Could not establish connection to redis 10.46.89.57:57714 (context.err = 1) *** Check failure stack trace: *** @ 0x7f9b27d3f98d (unknown) @ 0x7f9b27d40dfc (unknown) </denchmark-code>
If we cannot run your script, we cannot fix your issue.
I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue. I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
